The &app_name; app let the user connect his smartphone with multiple wearable devices. The app will periodically send data to a MongoDB identified by the Mac address of the phone.
It works as follows:
&scan_button; button: pressing this button brings you to a new screen where you will be able to look for the available wearable devices near you.
&fav_button; button: pressing this button brings you to a new screen where you will be able to check your favourite wearable devices.
Warning: The user has to give Bluetooth and Location privileges to the app. This settings shall be activated for a proper function of the app.
Which device would you like to connect?

This tab allocates the information of a SmartBand device (when connected).

This tab allocates the information of an MMR device (when connected).
First it shows the MAC address of the device and two main buttons, which Start or Stop the information exchange between the device and the smartphone and also between the smartphone and the database.
The colors of the MAC address mean the following:
The green color indicates that the device is properly connected and the smartphone is collecting data and sending it to the DataBase.
The orange color indicates that the smartphone is trying to reconnect the smartphone. It will be reconnected when it is within the range of the smartphone.
The orange color indicates that the smartphone is trying to reconnect the MMR. The reconnetion will star after 4min without receiving dta to collect, or by pressing the Stop button.
The red color indicates that the data collecting is stopped.
